logicmonitor-datasource-collectors.body:
data "logicmonitor_collectors" "$1" {
    # size - (Optional) The number of results to display. Max is 1000. Default is 50
    size = ""

    # offset - (Optional) The number of results to offset the displayed results by. Default is 0
    offset = ""

    # most_recent - (Optional) The most recent collector installed that is online
    most_recent = ""

    # filters - (Optional) Filters the response according to the operator and value specified. Note that you can use * to match on more than one character. More Info: https://www.logicmonitor.com/support/rest-api-developers-guide/device-groups/get-device-groups/
    filters = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
logicmonitor-datasource-collectors.description: Use this datasource to get the ID of an available collector.

logicmonitor-datasource-device-group.body:
data "logicmonitor_device_group" "$1" {
    # size - (Optional) The number of results to display. Max is 1000. Default is 50
    size = ""

    # offset - (Optional) The number of results to offset the displayed results by. Default is 0
    offset = ""

    # filters - (Optional) Filters the response according to the operator and value specified. Note that you can use * to match on more than one character. More Info: https://www.logicmonitor.com/support/rest-api-developers-guide/device-groups/get-device-groups/
    filters = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
logicmonitor-datasource-device-group.description: Use this datasource to get the ID of an available device group.

logicmonitor-resource-collector-group.body:
resource "logicmonitor_collector_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of collector group
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Set description of collector group
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
logicmonitor-resource-collector-group.description: Provides a LogicMonitor collector group resource. This can be used to create and manage LogicMonitor users

logicmonitor-resource-device-group.body:
resource "logicmonitor_device_group" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of device group
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of device group
    description = ""

    # parent_id - (Optional) The id of the parent group for this device group (the root device group has an Id of 1)
    parent_id = ""

    # applies_to - (Optional) The Applies to custom query for this group. Setting this field will make this a dynamic group.
    applies_to = ""

    # disable_alerting - (Optional) Indicates whether alerting is disabled (true) or enabled (false) for this device group
    disable_alerting = ""

    # properties - (Optional) The properties associated with this device group. Any string value pair will work (see example).
    properties = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
logicmonitor-resource-device-group.description: Provides a LogicMonitor device group resource. This can be used to create and manage LogicMonitor device groups

logicmonitor-resource-device-x.body:
resource "logicmonitor_device" "$1" {
    # ip_addr - (Required) Ip Address/Hostname of device
    ip_addr = ""

    # collector - (Optional) (required) The id of the collector that will monitoring the device
    collector = ""

    # display_name - (Optional) Display name of device, (default is ip_addr)
    display_name = ""

    # disable_alerting - (Optional) The host is created with alerting disabled (default is true)
    disable_alerting = ""

    # hostgroup_id - (Optional) The host group id that specifies which group the device belongs to (multiple host group ids can be added, represented by a comma separated string)
    hostgroup_id = ""

    # properties - (Optional) The properties associated with this device group. Any string value pair will work (see example).
    properties = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
logicmonitor-resource-device-x.description: Provides a LogicMonitor device resource. This can be used to create and manage LogicMonitor devices
